newsitem.title: INDIA: India's Yadav asks 3 supporters to quit cabinet.
newsitem.headline: India's Yadav asks 3 supporters to quit cabinet.

text.p: Laloo Prasad Yadav, leader of the breakaway Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) group of Prime Minister Inder Kumar Gujral's Janata Dal party, on Friday asked three supporters in Gujral's cabinet to resign, the Press Trust of India (PTI) said.

The ruling United Front coalition said on Thursday after a four-hour meeting tht it had decided not to admit Yadav's party into the alliance. PTI quoted Yadav as saying his party would support the government from outside.

Agriculture Minister Raghuvansh Prasad Singh, Coal Minister Kanti Singh and Non-conventional Energy Sources Minister Jainarayan Prasad Nishad would decide later on Friday about their course of action, the United News of India quoted Nishad as saying.
